attributes.action: Treat the EU election as a referendum on the ‘first past the post’ voting system
attributes.additional_details: If the combined Conservative Party and Labour Party vote in the European Elections is less than 25% of the popular vote and if the voter turnout is 50% or more, then the ‘first past the post’ voting system will be thoroughly discredited. Labour and the Tories will have less than half the electorate, but more than 85% of the power! The two main parties must agree to act against their interest, but in the best interests of the United Kingdom, and introduce proportional representation.
attributes.background: The European election results should be treated as a referendum on the ‘first past the post’ voting system. Support of Labour and the Conservatives is at a record low, but the current voting system means that they will never be out of power. This is not democratic.
